name: Ready For Some Football? Quiz | American Football | 10 Questions

questions.text: What team made their first appearance at Super Bowl VII?
questions.explanation:
Washington Redskins.

	Super Bowl VII played on January 14, 1973, was also the Miami Dolphins second consecutive year at the Super Bowl. The Dolphins beat the Redskins with a score of 14-7.

questions.text: On January 24, 1982, the Super Bowl was played at the Pontiac Silverdome. What state was the dome located?
questions.explanation:
Michigan.

	There were 81,270 people that took the stands to watch the game at Pontiac Silverdome in Pontiac, Michigan to see San Francisco beat Cincinnati with a score of 26-21.

questions.text: Which Super Bowl marked the fourth time in eight years that Bud Grant had his Minnesota Vikings play in the championship game?
questions.explanation:
Super Bowl XI.

	On January 9, 1977, the Oakland Raiders beat the Minnesota Vikings with a score of 32-14, at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, California.

questions.text: Who sang the National Anthem at Super Bowl XXXIII?
Who scored the first touchdown in Super Bowl history?
questions.explanation:
Max McGee.

	Max McGee got seven passes and two touchdowns for the Green Bay Packer at the first Super Bowl.

questions.text: Which team was the first to win a Super Bowl played indoors?
questions.explanation:
Cowboys.

	On January, 15, 1978, the Dallas Cowboys played Super Bowl XII indoors at the Louisiana Superdome, and beat the Broncos 27-10.

questions.text: What year did the first Super Bowl occur?
questions.explanation:
1967.

	The first Super Bowl was played by the Green Bay Packers and the Kansas City Chiefs on January 15, 1967. The Packers won the game with a score of 35-10.

questions.text: Who came up with the term Super Bowl?
questions.explanation:
Lamar Hunt.

	Lamar was playing with his daughter's Super Ball, when he came up with the name for the game against the AFL and the NFL.

questions.text: In Super Bowl II , where was the game played at?
questions.explanation:
Orange Bowl.

	The Green Bay Packers beat the Oakland Raiders 33-14 at Miami's Orange Bowl. The game was watched by a total of 75, 546 people in the stands on January 14, 1968.

questions.text: On January 12, 1969, the New York Jets played the Baltimore Colts. Who was the quarterback of the Jets at that time?
questions.explanation:
Joe Namath.

	Joe Namath made a bet at the Miami Touchdown club that his Jets would beat the Colts. The Jets won by a score of 16-7.
